channel.title: Source compiler
channel.description:
[code]The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue . . . [/code]
I get this when I try to run my source compiler. My client compiler works fine but its my source compiler that won't work. This is what my edit is :
@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre1.6.0_01\bin\java.exe" -cp asm-all-3.3.jar;clientlibs.jar; RunClient pause
Can someone help? My skype name is cameron.124

item.title: Source compiler
item.dc:creator: @zoomer zoomer
item.description:
@zoomer wrote:

[quote=“silver1337, post:3, topic:443092”]go to http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk-7u4-downloads-1591156.html
download it to your operation system and then when u open tick the thingy “change installing folder”
then click install and change that to C:\Program Files\Java
after u done that just install it and change
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre1.6.0_01\bin\java.exe”
in your compiler to
C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.7.0_04\bin\javac.exe[/quote]

Lol I think people would rather use a updated version of jdk to run the “server” & a low jdk version lets say Jdk 6u32 to run the “compiler” it makes big differences if you didn’t know that.

Also flame me saying it doesn’t your just to retarded to look.

Read full topic

item.title: Source compiler
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

Get the newest version of java.
Then when it’s installed you go to start > my computer > disc C (or whatever partition label you’re using) > program files > java > Jre > Bin
Then copy that location and replace it with the original one in your compiler.

Read full topic

item.title: Source compiler
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“nickog15, post:8, topic:443092”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=545781.msg4000722#msg4000722 date=1337955959]

The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue . . .

I get this when I try to run my source compiler.
My client compiler works fine but its my source compiler that won’t work.
This is what my edit is :

@echo off
Title Compiler

“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre1.6.0_01\bin\java.exe” -cp asm-all-3.3.jar;clientlibs.jar; RunClient
pause

Can someone help? My skype name is cameron.124

I’ve highlighted your problem.
[/quote]

Well, sir, if you know what the problem is, then why don’t you help the man. Jesus Christ.

NO, lol am i the only one in here that is not a idiot? No offence.

@echo off
Title Compiler

“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java[b]jre1.6.0_01[/b]\bin\java.exe” -cp asm-all-3.3.jar;clientlibs.jar; RunClient
pause

That is your problem. Here is the right code according to your jre.

@echo off
Title Compiler

“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java[b]jre1.7.0[/b]\bin\java.exe” -cp asm-all-3.3.jar;clientlibs.jar; RunClient
pause[/quote]

You sir, are in fact an idiot. Seeing as you spoonfed the kid.
There is an ENTIRE section on common compiler issues, INCLUDING this one here. So me HIGHLIGHTING his issue, is a good thing. If you can’t read that the area i colored in red shows a computer path then you have a problem (you in third person, not directed towards anyone). If you would take the time to look at the code instead of just the error you could solve this in a matter of minutes.
First the obvious hint: the system cannot FIND THE PATH SPECIFIED!

If that wasn’t obvious enough. It says, hey stupid fix where your telling me to get the java program.

Second read the code:

"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre1.6.0_01\bin\java.exe" -cp asm-all-3.3.jar;clientlibs.jar; RunClient pause
This is your basic run client code, though it includes a little more then I’m used to seeing. that doesn’t matter. What matters are these:

"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre1.6.0_01\bin\java.exe" and RunClient
First one is the path to get java.
Second is what script (.class file) it’s reading to start the client.

For the error he is having he just needs to look at the first part. the one telling the cmd to grab java.

So all he needs to do is update his java and make the code work for his java.

Thank you and good bye.

Read full topic

NO, lol am i the only one in here that is not a idiot? No offence.

item.title: Source compiler
item.dc:creator: @i_Ban_U i Ban U
item.description:
@i_Ban_U wrote:

K just do this, Download the new version of Java, then download a jdk… Once you have done that go to C:\Program Files\Java, then it will say something like Example: jdk1.6.0_25… The last to numbers (25) on the jdk1.6.0_25 is your version of jdk. Put those 2 numbers

So my version of jdk is 25 so I put 25 at the end of jre1.6.0_(here)
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre1.6.0_25\bin\java.exe”

Read full topic

item.title: Source compiler
item.dc:creator: @gamestop666 gamestop666
item.description:
@gamestop666 wrote:

Ok I made sure that I DO have JDK 1.7.0_04 and I also have JRE 7. Even when I change the jre.1.6.0_01 to jre.1.7.0_04 it still doesn’t work. Do I have to use JDK or JRE for it to work? And if I use JRE then do I put just jre7 or jre.1.7.0_04?

Read full topic

item.title: Source compiler
item.dc:creator: @Storm_Powner Storm Powner
item.description:
@Storm_Powner wrote:

install that one but use this: “C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre1.6.0_01\bin\java.exe”

too this: “C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_04\bin\java.exe”

or this: “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_04\bin\java.exe”

Read full topic

item.title: Source compiler
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“silver1337, post:3, topic:443092”]go to http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk-7u4-downloads-1591156.html
download it to your operation system and then when u open tick the thingy “change installing folder”
then click install and change that to C:\Program Files\Java
after u done that just install it and change
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre1.6.0_01\bin\java.exe”
in your compiler to
C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.7.0_04\bin\javac.exe[/quote]

You are ignorant.
They have installations for 32 bit (the x86 folder) and 64 bit computers. Assuming he has a 64 bit computer, he will need to locate the 64 bit download of JDK and JRE 7.0_04. If he doesn’t it will save in the x86 folder.
There is no need to move the 32 bit download to the 64 bit folder.

Read full topic
